benak.tomas.crimemonitor.service

Class CrimeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.service.CrimeService

  • @Path(value="/service")
public class CrimeService
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to handle the service requests.
    Author:
    Tom notes: RUIAN RDF store Crime RDF store global prefix mappings

    Implementation note: every public API method returns a JSON serialization of one of the crime statistics data holder types.

    Crime statistics data holder types are:

    • CrimesSummary
    • CrimeSummaryDetailed
    • CrimesList
    • CrimeUtvarDetail
    • UtvarKodANazev

    Configuration

    Loading configuration, exceptions etc.

    Error reporting

    Internal errors etc.

    Crime count monthly histogram: rename?

    See Also:
    CrimesSummary, CrimeSummaryDetailed, CrimesList, CrimeUtvarDetail, UtvarKodANazev

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  CrimeService.CrimeDetailOverviewInfo
      A class used to store the values loaded from the "get the crime detail" SPARQL result set solution.
      private class  CrimeService.MaxCrimeIndexInfo
      A class used as a holder for the maximum crimes per capita information.

      • CrimeService

        public CrimeService()
             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructs a new instance of CrimeService.

        The PostgreSQL JDBC driver is loaded at this point.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the JDBC driver class hasn't been found

    • Method Detail

      • addEmptyObservations

        private void addEmptyObservations(java.util.Calendar currentCal,
                        int year,
                        int month,
                        java.util.List<CrimeMonthHistogramObservation> monthObservationsList)
        Fills in the gaps for the interval of months with no observation data.

        The interval between the month identified by the currentCal and the month identified by the given year and month is calculated.
        If n is the length of this interval in months, for the first (n - 1) months there is no observation data. The observations for those months get the observed value of 0.

        Parameters:
        currentCal - the Calendar used to identify the starting month of the interval of months
        year - the year number for the ending month of the interval of months
        month - the month number for the ending month of the interval of months
        monthObservationsList - the list of histogram observations. The generated empty observations are inserted into this list.

      • calculateCrimeIndex

        private java.lang.Float calculateCrimeIndex(int tsk,
                                  int pocetTrestnychCinu,
                                  int pocetObyvatel,
                                  int startYear,
                                  int startMonth,
                                  int endYear,
                                  int endMonth,
                                  java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                  javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                     throws CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException,
                                            CrimeServiceInternalErrorException
        Calculates the crime index value for a given kind of crime, department and crime data interval.

        The number of committed crimes of the given kind and the number of inhabitants for the given department are passed in as parameters. The crimes per capita is calculated using those parameters. Then the crime index value is computed using the method described in CrimesSummaryBasic.

        Parameters:
        tsk - the TSK identifier of a kind of crime
        pocetTrestnychCinu - the number of committed crimes
        pocetObyvatel - the number of inhabitants living in the territory of the given department
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        the crime index value for a given kind of crime, department and crime data interval
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the configuration error occurs when trying to get the maximum crimes per capita value
        CrimeServiceInternalErrorException - if there was no data returned when trying to get the maximum crimes per capita value

      • calculateCrimeIndex

        private java.lang.Float calculateCrimeIndex(int pocetTrestnychCinu,
                                  int pocetObyvatel,
                                  int startYear,
                                  int startMonth,
                                  int endYear,
                                  int endMonth,
                                  java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                  javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                     throws CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException,
                                            CrimeServiceInternalErrorException
        Calculates the crime index value for a given department and crime data interval.

        The number of committed crimes and the number of inhabitants for the given department are passed in as parameters. The crimes per capita is calculated using those parameters. Then the crime index value is computed using the method described in CrimesSummaryBasic.

        Parameters:
        pocetTrestnychCinu - the number of committed crimes
        pocetObyvatel - the number of inhabitants living in the territory of the given department
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        the crime index value for a given department and crime data interval
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the configuration error occurs when trying to get the maximum crimes per capita value
        CrimeServiceInternalErrorException - if there was no data returned when trying to get the maximum crimes per capita value

      • getCrimeDetail

        @GET
@Path(value="/detail/{tsk}")
@Produces(value="application/json; charset=utf8")
public java.lang.String getCrimeDetail(@PathParam(value="tsk")
                                                int tsk,
                                                @QueryParam(value="kodUtvaru")
                                                java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                                @QueryParam(value="startYear")
                                                int startYear,
                                                @QueryParam(value="startMonth")
                                                int startMonth,
                                                @QueryParam(value="endYear")
                                                int endYear,
                                                @QueryParam(value="endMonth")
                                                int endMonth,
                                                @Context
                                                javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                throws CrimeServiceInternalErrorException,
                                       CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException
        Returns a string representation of the crime detail for a given kind of crime, police department and crime data interval.

        The crime detail data holder type is CrimeSummaryDetailed.

        The kind of crime is identified by a TSK identifier.

        If there have been no crimes committed of a given kind for the given department and crime data interval, null is returned to be considered an an empty result.

        Parameters:
        tsk - the TSK identifier of a kind of crime
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the crime detail for a given crime kind, police department and crime data interval
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the configuration could not be loaded
        CrimeServiceInternalErrorException - if an internal error occurred

      • getCrimeList

        @GET
@Path(value="/list")
@Produces(value="application/json; charset=utf8")
public java.lang.String getCrimeList(@QueryParam(value="kodUtvaru")
                                              java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                              @QueryParam(value="startYear")
                                              int startYear,
                                              @QueryParam(value="startMonth")
                                              int startMonth,
                                              @QueryParam(value="endYear")
                                              int endYear,
                                              @QueryParam(value="endMonth")
                                              int endMonth,
                                              @Context
                                              javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                              throws CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException,
                                     CrimeServiceInternalErrorException
        Returns a string representation of the ranking of all crimes for a given department and crime data interval.

        The crime ranking data holder type is CrimesSummary.

        If there are no crimes for the given department and crime data interval, null is returned to be considered an an empty result.

        Parameters:
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the ranking of all crimes for a given department and crime data interval
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the configuration could not be loaded
        CrimeServiceInternalErrorException - if an internal error occurred

      • getCrimeObservationsFromHistogram

        private double[][] getCrimeObservationsFromHistogram(CrimeMonthHistogramObservation[] monthHistogram)
        Returns a series of points in the 2-dimensional space, ordered by their x-coordinate, extracting it from the provided collection of histogram observations.
        Parameters:
        monthHistogram - the crime count monthly histogram to extract the point series from
        Returns:
        a series of points in the 2-dimensional space, ordered by their x-coordinate

      • getCrimeTimeSeriesForUtvar

        private double[][] getCrimeTimeSeriesForUtvar(java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                    int startYear,
                                    int startMonth,
                                    int endYear,
                                    int endMonth,
                                    javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                       throws CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException
        Returns a crimes count time series for a given department and crime data interval.

        A crime count time series observation is created using a month of the given crime data interval as the time point and using the respective total crime count for that month as a time series observation value.

        Parameters:
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        a crimes count time series for a given department and crime data interval; null is meant to indicate an empty result
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the SPARQL query text used to retrieve the crimes count time series could not be loaded

        See CrimesSummaryBasic for the detailed explanation of the crime trend computation algorithm.

        Returns:

      • getHistogramForCrimeDetail

        private CrimeMonthHistogramObservation[] getHistogramForCrimeDetail(int tsk,
                                                          java.lang.String kodUtvaru,
                                                          int startYear,
                                                          int startMonth,
                                                          int endYear,
                                                          int endMonth,
                                                          javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                                             throws CrimeServiceInternalErrorException,
                                                                    CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException
        Returns a crime count monthly histogram for a given kind of crime, department code and crime data interval.

        The histogram is technically just an ordered series of histogram observations, so an ordered array of CrimeMonthHistogramObservation is returned.

        The returned value of null indicates an empty result.

        For the definition of a crime count monthly histogram, see CrimeMonthHistogramObservation.

        Parameters:
        tsk - the TSK identifier of the kind of crime
        kodUtvaru - the department code
        startYear - the crime data interval initial year
        startMonth - the crime data interval initial month
        endYear - the crime data interval terminal year
        endMonth - the crime data interval terminal month
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        the ordered array of observations of the crime count monthly histogram for the given kind of crime, department code and crime data interval
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceInternalErrorException - if the
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the configuration could not be loaded

      • getMonthsBetweenDates

        private int getMonthsBetweenDates(java.util.Calendar cal,
                        int year,
                        int month)
        Gets the number of months between the two months.

        The first month is given in Calendar and the second month is identified with the given year and month number.

        The resulting number m is the number of months you would need to add to the Java Calendar with cal.add(Calendar.MONTH, m) so that cal.get(Calendar.YEAR) == year & cal.get(Calendar.MONTH) == month.

        Parameters:
        cal - the calendar to calculate the month difference for
        year - the year number
        month - the month number
        Returns:
        the number of months between the two months

      • prepareQueryString

        private com.hp.hpl.jena.query.ParameterizedSparqlString prepareQueryString(java.lang.String queryScriptFilePath,
                                                                 com.hp.hpl.jena.shared.PrefixMapping prefixMapping,
                                                                 javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
                                                                    throws CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException
        Creates a parametrized SPARQL query string using a provided path to the SPARQL script and a set of prefix mappings.

        The SPARQL query text is loaded from the given path. Then the parametrized SPARQL query string is created using the provided set of prefix mappings.

        Parameters:
        queryScriptFilePath - the provided path to the SPARQL script
        prefixMapping - the set of prefix mappings
        context - the injected servlet context helper object
        Returns:
        a parametrized SPARQL query string
        Throws:
        CrimeServiceConfigurationErrorException - if the SPARQL query text could not be loaded from the appropriate config file

        Returns:
